sentences.sContent: You should never judge a person by their looks.
Judge us on the improvements we make in the economy.
sentences.sCn: 请根据我们在经济方面取得的进步来评价我们。

sentences.sContent: The therapist judged that Margaret had made a serious attempt to kill herself.
sentences.sCn: 治疗专家断定玛格丽特曾真的企图自杀。

sentences.sContent: pollutants that were judged hazardous to human health
sentences.sCn: 被认为对人体健康有害的污染物

sentences.sContent: I am in no position to judge whether what she is doing is right or wrong.
sentences.sCn: 我无权评判她在做的事是对是错。

sentences.sContent: The economic results of the reforms are very difficult to judge.
sentences.sCn: 这些改革所带来的经济成效很难评价。

sentences.sContent: The likelihood of future bombs was impossible to judge.
sentences.sCn: 未来发生爆炸案的可能性无法预测。

sentences.sContent: We judge the success of a product by the number of sales it brings in.
sentences.sCn: 我们以销量来评价一种产品成功与否。

sentences.sContent: His conduct, judged objectively by what he has done, is dishonest.
sentences.sCn: 他的行为，从他所做的这一切客观地来评价，是不诚实的。

sentences.sContent: Robert wanted to go and help him, but judged it best to stay where he was.
sentences.sCn: 罗伯特想过去帮他，但考虑之后还是觉得待在原地为妙。

sentences.sContent: Do not judge her too harshly, as she was very young at the time.
sentences.sCn: 对她的评价不要太苛刻，毕竟那时候她还很年轻。
